storyTitle: As Team Lead, I want to view task status reports to achieve real-time monitoring of task progress and completion

testCases.title: Generate task status report with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Task Status Reporting
Task management database contains task data with various statuses
At least one project exists with tasks in pending, in-progress, and completed statuses
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with filter options including project, team, and priority dropdowns

steps.action: Select a valid project from the project filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected project is highlighted in the dropdown and filter is applied without errors

steps.action: Select a valid priority level from the priority filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected priority is highlighted in the dropdown and filters are accepted without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to submit report generation request
steps.expectedResult: Task status report is generated and displayed within 5 seconds showing tasks categorized by pending, in-progress, and completed statuses matching the selected filters

steps.action: Verify the report displays task count for each status category
steps.expectedResult: Report shows accurate count of tasks in pending, in-progress, and completed categories

postconditions: Task status report is displayed on screen
Report data matches the applied filters
User remains on the Task Status Reporting page
Filters remain selected for subsequent operations

testCases.title: Export task status report to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Task Status Reporting
Task status report has been generated with valid filters
Report data is displayed on screen
Browser has download permissions enabled
Sufficient disk space available for file downloads

steps.action: Generate task status report by selecting project and priority filters and clicking 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed on screen with task data categorized by status

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded to the default download location with filename containing report name and timestamp

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and displays correct report data including all task statuses, applied filters, and task details matching the on-screen report

steps.action: Return to the task status report page and click the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is downloaded to the default download location with filename containing report name and timestamp

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully and displays correct report data in structured format with columns for task details, status categories, and applied filters matching the on-screen report

steps.action: Verify data integrity in both exported files
steps.expectedResult: Both PDF and Excel files contain identical data matching the on-screen report with 100% accuracy

postconditions: PDF file is saved in downloads folder
Excel file is saved in downloads folder
Both files contain accurate report data
User remains on the Task Status Reporting page
Report remains displayed on screen

testCases.title: Verify real-time update of task status report
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Task Status Reporting
At least one project exists with tasks in various statuses
Real-time update mechanism is enabled
Backend task management system is accessible
WebSocket or polling mechanism for real-time updates is active

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section and select a specific project filter
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with filter options

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' to open task status report for the selected project
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed showing current task statuses with counts for pending, in-progress, and completed categories

steps.action: Note the current count of tasks in each status category (pending, in-progress, completed)
steps.expectedResult: Current task counts are visible and documented

steps.action: Update a task status in the backend system (e.g., move a task from pending to in-progress)
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated in the backend database

steps.action: Monitor the report UI for automatic updates without manual refresh
steps.expectedResult: Report UI updates automatically within 10 seconds showing the status change

steps.action: Verify the updated task statuses are reflected in the report by checking task counts
steps.expectedResult: Report shows latest task status information with updated counts (e.g., pending count decreased by 1, in-progress count increased by 1)

steps.action: Verify the specific task that was updated now appears in the correct status category
steps.expectedResult: The updated task is displayed in the new status category with accurate details

postconditions: Task status report displays real-time updated data
Task counts reflect the latest status changes
No manual page refresh was required
Report remains functional for further operations
Backend task status remains updated

storyTitle: As Team Lead, I want to filter task status reports by priority to achieve focused monitoring of critical tasks

testCases.title: Filter task status report by valid priority
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Task Status Reporting
Task database contains tasks with different priority levels (High, Medium, Low)
At least one task exists for each priority level
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with filter options including priority dropdown

steps.action: Click on the priority filter dropdown to view available priority options
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing all available priority levels (High, Medium, Low)

steps.action: Select 'High' priority from the filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Priority filter is applied and 'High' is displayed as the selected value in the dropdown

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds and displays task status data only for tasks with High priority

steps.action: Verify all displayed tasks have 'High' priority assigned
steps.expectedResult: All tasks in the report show 'High' priority and no Medium or Low priority tasks are displayed

steps.action: Verify tasks are categorized by status (pending, in-progress, completed) within the priority filter
steps.expectedResult: Report displays High priority tasks grouped by their status categories with accurate counts

steps.action: Change priority filter to 'Medium' and regenerate the report
steps.expectedResult: Report updates to display only Medium priority tasks across all status categories

postconditions: Filtered task status report is displayed on screen
Only tasks matching the selected priority are shown
Report data is accurate with 100% priority filtering accuracy
Priority filter remains selected for export operations
User remains on the Task Status Reporting page

testCases.title: Handle invalid priority filter input
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Task Status Reporting
Task Status Reporting page is accessible
Priority filter validation is enabled
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with filter options

steps.action: Attempt to enter an invalid priority value in the priority filter field (e.g., 'Invalid', special characters, or numeric values)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message indicating 'Invalid priority value. Please select from available options: High, Medium, Low'

steps.action: Verify the error message is clearly visible near the priority filter field
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed in red text below or next to the priority filter with clear instructions

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button while invalid priority value is entered
steps.expectedResult: Report generation is blocked and system prevents submission with error message 'Please correct the priority filter before generating report'

steps.action: Verify the Generate Report button remains disabled or shows validation warning
steps.expectedResult: Generate Report button is either disabled or displays a tooltip indicating validation errors must be resolved

steps.action: Clear the invalid input and select a valid priority value from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Error message disappears and valid priority is accepted without errors

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' with valid priority filter
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated successfully displaying tasks matching the valid priority selection

postconditions: Invalid priority input is rejected by the system
Validation error messages are cleared after valid input
Report generation only proceeds with valid priority filter
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid filter values
User remains on the Task Status Reporting page
